reviews.review: I thought the story line would be overwhelming with all the characters involved, but it didn't turn out to be too confusing.  Good movie

He Actually snapped his fingers. This movie truly delivered. There were so many moments I lost my Sh*t. only thing that I didn't like was Midnights facal effects, wish they used makup insted of animating her face. Other thatn that I was blown away by everything and I mean everything. from
Marvel came through once again and delivered. Thanos is by far the best comic book villain to date. Well done Marvel, well done!

I’ve never felt compelled enough to give a rating after watching a movie so that should tell anyone reading this that this movie is amazing. A lot of what we all thought was gonna happen didn’t happen and what we thought didn’t did. Marvel is an amazing company and have created a movie that has so much heart but at the same time being entertaining with more action then any other MCU movie. This movie will make u laugh more then any other superhero movie out there.
A must watch. The movie was fantastic! Thanos was well portrayed by Josh Brolin. The ending both traumatized me and made me look forward to next year! :) <3
Amazing. Beautiful, action packed and heart wrenching. Unexpected as well as it is full of surprises and twists.
One of the best films that came out

SPOILER ALERT

Ok, so last night was practically the first marvel film I didn't enjoy. I mentioned this my husband when we left and he said "but you liked deathly hallows part one? They're practically the same!" And that got me thinking and reaffirmed WHY I walked away disappointed.

My first point, the pacing. Its so fast it could give you whiplash. It barrelled along at breakneck speed to show you all the awesome characters from the MCU but at the cost of character development and leaving everyone feeling like flat characters. The only one that didn't was Thanos. I enjoyed his development but not at the cost of undermining several interesting and compelling characters. So my second point, character development.

And here I'll draw comparison to deathly hallows for my husband's sake. DH did develop its characters, in fact it stressed it. The whole point of part one was gear them to the fight with a try and fail cycle. Every downbeat in deathly was followed up by an uptick in either determination, friendship or introspection. The pacing allowed for that and nurtured it. Where as in IW ... It's was all downbeats that undercut the character previously done development or tried to uptick on a one liner punchline. Infact at 5 minutes in I seriously questioned 'what was the point in Thor Ragnarok?' its message and Thor character progression was robbed in mere moments. To be honest... Thor's whole arc in IW destroys Ragnaroks message. This is recurring problem with nearly all the 'heros' in the story, they all fail and learnt nothing and don't progress, hell the only ONE I think that did learn died so that moment was kinda robbed too.

Now the narrative does follow logical conclusions are it barrels along. The main problem is that the hero's of the story achieve nothing, they learn nothing from thier failures and therefore don't progress. Even the deaths are anticlimactic, not one has a heroic death, one almost did before the movie went for a do over and fell flat. By half way, I could see the formula, knew what was coming, waitef for the twist that never came and emotionally checked out. In fact it became so formulaic that Thanos used the same tactic 3 times to achieve his goals. Torture loved one in front of hero, hero tries to grin and bear it but gives in, hero gives Thanos what he wants, Thanos then kills the hero. 3 times! In one movie!

By half way, I stopped enjoying the jokes and fight scenes because I knew the out come and was sorely disappointed.

So back to what my husband said, why did I enjoy Deathly Hallows and not Infinity wars? Well at the end of DH it's was grim, fearful but a strong sense determination and the will to go on in the face of death. IW left me exhausted defeated and learning nothing, and the movies hinted a resolution for its part two in a cryptic post credit clip about a magical captain mcguffin that's had no screen time or emotional build up that I assume at this point will perform a Deux Machina and that doesn't inspire me.

In all honesty, this should have been 2 movies ... There were too many characters on screen that fell flat or were undercut or retro developed, the pacing didn't get a chance to breathe. And some scenes were just pointless too, like the neurosurgery scene that goes nowhere plot wise.

All the characters were reduced to a narrative pawns which super underwhelming.

I really really want to like this. I've been looking forward to this for years and I hate that all I did was walk out disappointed and unenthused to see another marvel movie
